page.title: 01Chorley; an overview
page.content: Chorley is the main town within Chorley District Council. On the 1st.April, 1974 the new Chorley District came into being, joininng together the Adlington Urban District, Chorley Borough, Chorley Rural District and Withnell Urban District.Borough status was obtained and this took effect from the 1st.April,1974. Therefore Chorley has a Mayor. The new District formed is a non-metropolitan District within the county of Lancashire.The District covers an area of 50,642 acres with a population of over 80,000 The area is served by two motorways, the M6 to the West and M61 to the East of the Market town of Chorley,both running North to South and having an interchange just outside the District. The main A road is the A6 .
